title: Participation Form
content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Please copy the following Google Doc into your own drive:</paragraph><paragraph><link href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NkNZbLGbU-XeDaV6IqsEPuabpOqTri0YTqpkZ54-xhE/edit?usp=sharing">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NkNZbLGbU-XeDaV6IqsEPuabpOqTri0YTqpkZ54-xhE/edit?usp=sharing</link></paragraph><paragraph>And submit a PDF to Gradescope after you fill it out.  Submit to only one of the participation assignments --- the one that corresponds to the GSI/Tutor you feel would recognize you the best. For those counting on online (rather than in-person discussion), that is likely to be Kevin. </paragraph><paragraph>The form is due on Wednesday Dec 10th.</paragraph><paragraph>The time required to do this should be minimal. Take a selfie of sufficient quality that it will help course staff remember you clearly. Place that on the second page. Fill out the rest. </paragraph><paragraph>For those who did basic participation by coming to discussion and participating throughout the term, you basically just have to point us to your four Special Participation posts at the end. </paragraph><paragraph>If you need basic participation credit from having regularly interacted on Ed online instead, then also use the fourth and fifth page to insert screenshots of your posts/followups.  You have to fit within those two pages.</paragraph><paragraph>The purpose of doing this is to allow you yourself to put yourself in the best light possible vis-a-vis your class participation. Remember, participation is worth 15% of your grade. (It's impossible to get an A of any kind without participation. There is no curve and we use fixed bins.)</paragraph></document>
document:
Please copy the following Google Doc into your own drive:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1NkNZbLGbU-XeDaV6IqsEPuabpOqTri0YTqpkZ54-xhE/edit?usp=sharing

And submit a PDF to Gradescope after you fill it out.  Submit to only one of the participation assignments --- the one that corresponds to the GSI/Tutor you feel would recognize you the best. For those counting on online (rather than in-person discussion), that is likely to be Kevin. 

The form is due on Wednesday Dec 10th.

The time required to do this should be minimal. Take a selfie of sufficient quality that it will help course staff remember you clearly. Place that on the second page. Fill out the rest. 

For those who did basic participation by coming to discussion and participating throughout the term, you basically just have to point us to your four Special Participation posts at the end. 

If you need basic participation credit from having regularly interacted on Ed online instead, then also use the fourth and fifth page to insert screenshots of your posts/followups.  You have to fit within those two pages.

The purpose of doing this is to allow you yourself to put yourself in the best light possible vis-a-vis your class participation. Remember, participation is worth 15% of your grade. (It's impossible to get an A of any kind without participation. There is no curve and we use fixed bins.)

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Is it problematic if the Gradescope questions in my submission don't align properly with the pages? The image + the special participation page did not get correctly assigned, even though I did not change # of pages or the order.</paragraph></document>
comments.document: Is it problematic if the Gradescope questions in my submission don't align properly with the pages? The image + the special participation page did not get correctly assigned, even though I did not change # of pages or the order.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>I shrank my photo until everything fit into the grids they provided. I think it matters for whatever process they are using to go through these. It might be worth to resubmit.</paragraph><paragraph/></document>
comments.document: I shrank my photo until everything fit into the grids they provided. I think it matters for whatever process they are using to go through these. It might be worth to resubmit.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>I am having the same problem, how did you shrink it? when I click on my special participation credit it goes to the 2nd page of the EdStem credit, should I put all the edstem stuff on one page and replace the 2nd edstem page with the special participation credit?</paragraph></document>

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>I did two Special Participation D's, but there isn't a Gradescope submission for them. I posted both of them on Edstem.<break/><break/>Will something on gradescope be opened for them, or is posting on Edstem + the Participant/Citizen form submission with a screenshot sufficient?</paragraph><paragraph/></document>
comments.document:
I did two Special Participation D's, but there isn't a Gradescope submission for them. I posted both of them on Edstem.

Will something on gradescope be opened for them, or is posting on Edstem + the Participant/Citizen form submission with a screenshot sufficient?

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Fixed. Go ahead and submit to gradescope.</paragraph></document>
comments.document: Fixed. Go ahead and submit to gradescope.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>I submitted the main participation form which then linked to my special participation. However, I didn't submit anything on the special participations on Gradescope is that fine? I realized I might've misinterpreted the instructions lol</paragraph></document>
comments.document: I submitted the main participation form which then linked to my special participation. However, I didn't submit anything on the special participations on Gradescope is that fine? I realized I might've misinterpreted the instructions lol

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>I emailed them to my TA is that ok? The gradescope ones are locked. I made the posts before the deadline though + have the PDFs dated before deadline. I misinterpreted and thought if you didn't do basic and only special then we would submit there. I read "submit to only one of the participation assignments" and "just have to point us to your four Special Participation posts at the end" then confused myself. Sorry about that</paragraph><paragraph>I had submitted the basic on gradescope which points to my posts though on Tuesday</paragraph></document>
comments.document:

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Hi, I was very sick over the past four days and wasn’t able to submit this on December 10th. I wanted to ask if I could please submit it now.
